The line that I know for white is to play 6. a3, 7. b4 with Bb2 to follow.   Since white didn't play this line, this determines Black's next move.
moves.6... a6: Minuscule better than Bd7.  The idea is that White is going to have a harder time protecting D pawn, so he would like to be able to play 7. Bb5, even though I normally dislike Bb5 against the french.
moves.9... Nxd4: Only gives black a tiny advantage according to computer analysis.   So what is White's compensation?
moves.10. Be3: Black has no problem dealing with this.
moves.12... Qxe5 13. Rfe1: 13. Bf4 Qd4 14. Nb3 Qb4 15. Rab1 Qxa4 16. Be5 b5 was a little better.
moves.14... Qxh2+ 15. Kf1 h5 16. Qf3: 16. Qxg7? Be5 17. Qg5 Bxa1 18. Rxa1?? Qh1+
moves.17. Ke2 e5 18. Reh1 Qxh1: A major blunder.  Black needed to play 18. ... e4!
moves.19. Rxh1: No good now is Bg4 because of Qxg4.
moves.19... e4: With this  move, white's advantage is tiny.
moves.21... Bxa4 22. Bxb7:
Black gets just enough counter play to matter.
22. Rxh5 is the better choice.
moves.25. Bd4:
Disaster.
